page.title: 14Tattingstone Village
page.content:
Tattingstone is a quiet little village. The part of Tattingstone in our survey area has one pub, a chapel, an ironworks and a playing field with four tennis courts.
We moved to Tattingstone in 1981. We spent two years renovating our cottage. At first we lived in a caravan in the garden. All the woodwork had to be sprayed to kill the woodworm. Eventually we finished and we changed to name from Beckdale back to Tinkers Hole which was its original name.
Part of the Alton Water reservoir near Tattingstone place is a nature conservation area. Lots of bird watchers go here to see coots, moorhens, great crested grebes, herons and many other types of bird.
